intro: Hymenoxys macrantha, commonly known as the showy hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a distinct lobed shape. Hymenoxys macrantha thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
